# Day-0 : Course Overview {-}

This course introduces **R programming** for statistical analysis, data visualization,  
and introductory genomic data exploration.

It is designed as a **hands-on, reproducible course** using **RMarkdown** and **Bookdown**.

---

## Course Objectives

By the end of this course, students will be able to:

- Write basic R programs
- Manipulate and visualize data
- Perform common statistical analyses
- Explore genomic data using Bioconductor
- Produce reproducible analysis reports

---

## What This Course Is **Not** About

We will not focus on:

- Advanced programming concepts or algorithms

- Software engineering practices or application development

- Writing optimized or production-level R code

---

## Target Audience

- Life science students
- Beginners to R programming
- Researchers starting data analysis

No prior programming experience is required.

---

## Software Requirements

- **R version 4.5.x**
- **RStudio Desktop**
- Linux (Ubuntu/Debian preferred)

All installation steps are covered in the next chapter.

---

## Course Structure

- **Day 0:** Course overview & installation  
- **Day 1:** R fundamentals  
- **Day 2:** Data manipulation & visualization  
- **Day 3:** Statistical analysis  
- **Day 4:** Genomic data exploration  
- **Day 5:** Mini project
---

## How to Use This Book

- Read each chapter sequentially
- Run code examples locally in RStudio
- Attempt all hands-on exercises
- Use the navigation panel to move between days
